articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia 
   Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" was brought out in booklet by the Vladivostok Publishing House of Russia.
 The work, published on June 19, Juche 86 (1997), clarifies the idea that preserving the Juche character and national character of the revolution and construction is a fundamental principle that should be kept in accomplishing the cause of socialism, and the tasks and ways to carry it into practice.

Foreign Diplomats Visit School in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit School in Pyongyang 
   Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of foreign embassies here visited Pyongyang Middle School No. 1 on Tuesday on the occasion of the February holiday.
 The guests went round with keen interest a room for education in revolutionary history and various educational facilities, being briefed on the fact that the school has been built into the country's reliable centre for training talents under the deep loving care of Kim Jong Il.    
 Ioan Dedean, councilor of the Romanian embassy, said that the visit offered him an opportunity to know well how deep the DPRK government's attention to the education for generations to come is. He wished the school greater success in its educational work.

Kim Jong Il Expresses Condolences
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Expresses Condolences
   Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of the late People's Artiste Kim Chang Ryong, a conductor of the Mansudae Art Troupe, on Wednesday expressing deep condolences over his death.
